answers.answer: Hello,During pregnancy insulin resistance develops due to the baby. If your numbers are over now, they will only get higher in the next few months until baby arrives.Treatment starts of with diet.  You need to avoid sweets, white bread, candies, fruit juices.  Eat lower carb foods.  Eat regularly.If you can, a 30 minute walk after each meal will be very helpful, or at least 30 minutes of exercise every day.You will need to test your blood sugar regularly, as high blood sugars (even slightly high) are not good for baby.If diet and exercise are not able to keep your blood sugars on target then you will be given meds.  Most likely insulin.

question: I'm six months pregnant and my doctor thinks I have gestational diabetes because it was 7-10 points over each test how would it be treated
title: pregnant
